learning_outcomes.description: Understand and apply the thermodynamic principles relating to intermolecular and interfacial forces
Understand and apply fundamental aspects of polymer structure, synthesis and characterisation and to appreciate their applications in materials science
Understand and apply the principles of molecular spectroscopy.
Understand and apply the periodic properties of the main group elements and appreciate how relationships explain the structures and properties of their compounds

Demonstrate acquisition of, and proficiency in: laboratory skills and techniques; data processing and display; and critical appraisal of experimental outcomes related to concepts taught in the course.
Analyse and solve problems through the recognition of principles taught in lectures and the application of both quantitative and critical reasoning skills.

assessments.due_date:
13/08/2025 - 15/08/2025

17/09/2025 - 19/09/2025

8/10/2025 - 10/10/2025

22/10/2025 - 24/10/2025

Practical reports are required to be submitted 1 week after your experiment has been scheduled (eg Experiment 1 is scheduled on a Thurs/Fri in Week 3 will be due on Thursday/Friday at 5 pm in Week 4. An assessment schedule will be placed in the laboratory folder on Bb.
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Notebook/ Logbook, Practical/ Demonstration
assessments.task_description:
Four laboratory experiments will be completed across five separate three hour sessions (Experiment 3 (Polymer) has two parts) during the semester.

Completion of all the laboratory activities and assessment is a hurdle in this course. A printed laboratory manual for the laboratory activities will be provided to you in the first session and will also be available digitally in Bb - you are required to read the laboratory notes prior to coming to the laboratory and commencing the tasks. 

Each Experiment has a separate assessment submission with the following weighting:

Experiment 1: Laboratory Notebook and Worksheet Report 5%

Experiment 2 Report 10%

Experiment 3 Report 15%

Experiment 4 Report 10%

Reports are required to be submitted 1 week after your experiment has been scheduled (eg Experiment 1 is scheduled on a Thurs/Fri in Week 3 will be due on Thursday/Friday at 5 pm in Week 4. An assessment schedule will be placed in the laboratory folder on Bb.

Individual timetables for laboratory sessions will be sent by email, please note dates, times and experiments carefully. 

Each student will be provided with a laboratory manual - you are required to read the laboratory notes prior to coming to the laboratory. Protective glasses, appropriate footwear and a laboratory coat are essential and must be worn in the laboratory.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your Laboratory Report through the course Turnitin submission point in the relevant experiment folder in Blackboard. Before submitting your assessment item to Turnitin please name your file in the following way. FAMILY NAME_GivenName_StudentID_CourseCode_AssignmentName For example: Bob Smith (ID: 54329876) would name his ABCD1234 Experiment Report 1 in the following way. SMITH_Bob_54329876_ABCD1234_Experiment Report 1
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Participation/ Student contribution, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description:
There are five workshop sessions that involve submission of an assessment task, one from each module taught plus the laboratory workshop in Week 1. Students will need to complete their submission within 1 hour after the end time of the assigned contact session.

This is a Pass/Fail assessment where 4 out of a possible 5 workshop submissions that meet the task criteria are required.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The completed task materials need to be submitted either online or in person at the end of the workshop session (no coversheet is required).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This will be a 90 minute closed book, in-semester invigilated exam scheduled during Week 8 of semester, the exact time and venue will be announced through Bb and an email to students. Students will be permitted to bring one A4 page (double-sided) of handwritten notes into the examination and this will be collected with the exam paper at the end of the session.

This exam will address topics covered during Modules 1 & 2 (Spectroscopy and Thermodynamics).

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
This will be a 90 minute closed book, invigilated exam where students will be permitted to bring one A4 page of handwritten notes into the examination. The notes will be collected with the exam paper at the end of the session.

Concepts taught in modules 3 and 4 of the course (Polymer and Main Group chemistry) will be examined.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)
